   19: %%
   20: -module(erlc_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Tests the erlc command by compiling various types of files.
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   26:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   27:          compile_erl/1,
   28:          compile_yecc/1, compile_script/1,
   29:          compile_mib/1, good_citizen/1, deep_cwd/1, arg_overflow/1,
   30:          make_dep_options/1,
   31:          unicode_paths/1,
   32:          features_erlc_describe/1,
   33:          features_erlc_unknown/1,
   34:          features_directives/1,
   35:          features_atom_warnings/1,
   36:          features_macros/1,
   37:          features_disable/1,
   38:          features_all/1,
   39:          features_load/1,
   40:          features_runtime/1,
   41:          features_include/1,
   42:          features/1]).
   43: 
   44: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   45: 
   46: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   47: 
   48: all() ->
   49:     [{group,with_server},{group,without_server},
   50:      {group,features_with_server}].
   51: 
   52: groups() ->
   53:     Tests = tests(),
   54:     [{with_server,[],Tests},
   55:      {features_with_server,[],feature_tests()},
   56:      {without_server,[],Tests ++ feature_tests()}].
   57: 
   58: tests() ->
   59:     [compile_erl, compile_yecc, compile_script, compile_mib,
   60:      good_citizen, deep_cwd, arg_overflow, make_dep_options,
   61:      unicode_paths].
   62: 
   63: feature_tests() ->
   64:     [features_erlc_describe,
   65:      features_erlc_unknown,
   66:      features_directives,
   67:      features_atom_warnings,
   68:      features_macros,
   69:      features_disable,
   70:      features_all,
   71:      features_load,
   72:      features_runtime,
   73:      features_include,
   74:      features].
   75: 
   76: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   77:     Config.
   78: 
   79: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   80:     ok.
   81: 
   82: init_per_group(with_server, Config) ->
   83:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "yes"),
   84:     Config;
   85: init_per_group(features_with_server, Config) ->
   86:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "yes"),
   87:     timer:sleep(12 * 1000),
   88:     Config;
   89: init_per_group(without_server, Config) ->
   90:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "no"),
   91:     Config;
   92: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
   93:     Config.
   94: 
   95: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   96:     os:unsetenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER"),
   97:     os:unsetenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES"),
   98:     Config.
   99: 
  100: init_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  101:     case lists:member(TestCase, feature_tests()) of
  102:         true ->
  103:             os:putenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES", "true");
  104:         false ->
  105:             ok
  106:         end,
  107:     Config.
  108: 
  109: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  110:     case lists:member(TestCase, feature_tests()) of
  111:         true ->
  112:             os:putenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES", "true");
  113:         false ->
  114:             ok
  115:         end,
  116:     Config.
  117: 
  118: 
  119: %% Copy from erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test.hrl.
  120: 
  121: -record(person, {name, shoe_size}).
  122: 
  123: %% Tests that compiling Erlang source code works.
  124: 
  125: compile_erl(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  126:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  127:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  128:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  129: 
  130:     %% By default, warnings are now turned on.
  131:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "",
  132:         ["Warning: function foo/0 is unused\$", "_OK_"]),
  133: 
  134:     %% Test that the compiled file is where it should be,
  135:     %% and that it is runnable.
  136: 
  137:     {module, erl_test_ok} = code:load_abs(filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok")),
  138:     42 = erl_test_ok:shoe_size(#person{shoe_size=42}),
  139:     code:purge(erl_test_ok),
  140: 
  141:     %% Try disabling warnings.
  142: 
  143:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W0", ["_OK_"]),
  144: 
  145:     %% Try treating warnings as errors.
  146: 
  147:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-Werror",
  148:         ["compile: warnings being treated as errors\$",
  149:          "function foo/0 is unused\$", "_ERROR_"]),
  150: 
  151:     %% Check a bad file.
  152: 
  153:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_bad.erl"),
  154:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "", ["function non_existing/1 undefined\$",
  155:                                    "_ERROR_"]),
  156:     ok.
  157: 
  158: %% Test that compiling yecc source code works.
  159: 
  160: compile_yecc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  161:     {SrcDir, _, OutDir} = get_dirs(Config),
  162:     Cmd = erlc() ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
  163:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "yecc_test_ok.yrl"),
  164:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W0", ["_OK_"]),
  165:     true = exists(filename:join(OutDir, "yecc_test_ok.erl")),
  166: 
  167:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "yecc_test_bad.yrl"),
  168:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "-W0",
  169:         ["Nonterminals is missing\$",
  170:          "rootsymbol form is not a nonterminal\$",
  171:          "undefined nonterminal: form\$",
  172:          "_ERROR_"]),
  173:     exists(filename:join(OutDir, "yecc_test_ok.erl")),
  174:     ok.
  175: 
  176: %% Test that compiling start scripts works.
  177: 
  178: compile_script(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  179:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  180:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "start_ok.script"),
  181:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  182:     true = exists(filename:join(OutDir, "start_ok.boot")),
  183: 
  184:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "start_bad.script"),
  185:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "", ["syntax error before:", "_ERROR_"]),
  186:     ok.
  187: 
  188: %% Test that compiling SNMP mibs works.
  189: 
  190: compile_mib(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  191:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  192:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "GOOD-MIB.mib"),
  193:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  194:     Output = filename:join(OutDir, "GOOD-MIB.bin"),
  195:     true = exists(Output),
  196: 
  197:     %% Try -W option.
  198: 
  199:     ok = file:delete(Output),
  200:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W",
  201:         ["_OK_"]),
  202:     true = exists(Output),
  203: 
  204:     %% Try -W option and more verbose.
  205: 
  206:     ok = file:delete(Output),
  207:     case os:type() of
  208:         {unix,_} ->
  209:             run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W +'{verbosity,info}'",
  210:                 ["\\[GOOD-MIB[.]mib\\]\\[INF\\]: No accessfunction for 'sysDescr' => using default",
  211:                  "_OK_"]),
  212:             true = exists(Output),
  213:             ok = file:delete(Output);
  214:         _ -> ok				%Don't bother -- too much work.
  215:     end,
  216: 
  217:     %% Try a bad file.
  218: 
  219:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "BAD-MIB.mib"),
  220:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "",
  221:         ["BAD-MIB.mib: 1: syntax error before: mibs\$",
  222:          "compilation_failed_ERROR_"]),
  223: 
  224:     %% Make sure that no -I option works.
  225: 
  226:     NewCmd = erlc() ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
  227:     run(Config, NewCmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  228:     true = exists(Output),
  229: 
  230:     ok.
  231: 
  232: %% Checks that 'erlc' doesn't eat any input (important when called from a
  233: %% shell script with redirected input).
  234: good_citizen(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  235:     case os:type() of
  236:         {unix, _} ->
  237:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  238:             Answer = filename:join(PrivDir, "answer"),
  239:             Script = filename:join(PrivDir, "test_script"),
  240:             Test = filename:join(PrivDir, "test.erl"),
  241:             S = ["#! /bin/sh\n", "erlc ", Test, "\n",
  242:                  "read reply\n", "echo $reply\n"],
  243:             ok = file:write_file(Script, S),
  244:             ok = file:write_file(Test, "-module(test).\n"),
  245:             Cmd = "echo y | sh " ++ Script ++ " > " ++ Answer,
  246:             os:cmd(Cmd),
  247:             {ok, Answer0} = file:read_file(Answer),
  248:             [$y|_] = binary_to_list(Answer0),
  249:             ok;
  250:         _ ->
  251:             {skip, "Unix specific"}
  252:     end.
  253: 
  254: %% Make sure that compiling an Erlang module deep down in
  255: %% in a directory with more than 255 characters works.
  256: deep_cwd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  257:     case os:type() of
  258:         {unix, _} ->
  259:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  260:             deep_cwd_1(PrivDir);
  261:         _ ->
  262:             {skip, "Only a problem on Unix"}
  263:     end.
  264: 
  265: deep_cwd_1(PrivDir) ->
  266:     DeepDir0 = filename:join(PrivDir, lists:duplicate(128, $a)),
  267:     DeepDir = filename:join(DeepDir0, lists:duplicate(128, $b)),
  268:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(DeepDir,"any_file")),
  269:     ok = file:set_cwd(DeepDir),
  270:     ok = file:write_file("test.erl", "-module(test).\n\n"),
  271:     io:format("~s\n", [os:cmd("erlc test.erl")]),
  272:     true = filelib:is_file("test.beam"),
  273:     ok.
  274: 
  275: %% Test that a large number of command line switches does not
  276: %% overflow the argument buffer
  277: arg_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  278:     {SrcDir, _OutDir, Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  279:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  280:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  281:     %% Each -D option will be expanded to three arguments when
  282:     %% invoking 'erl'.
  283:     NumDOptions = num_d_options(),
  284:     Args = lists:flatten([ ["-D", integer_to_list(N, 36), "=1 "] ||
  285:                            N <- lists:seq(1, NumDOptions) ]),
  286:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, Args,
  287:         ["Warning: function foo/0 is unused\$",
  288:          "_OK_"]),
  289:     ok.
  290: 
  291: num_d_options() ->
  292:     case {os:type(),os:version()} of
  293:         {{win32,_},_} ->
  294:             %% The maximum size of a command line in the command
  295:             %% shell on Windows is 8191 characters.
  296:             %% Each -D option is expanded to "@dv NN 1", i.e.
  297:             %% 8 characters. (Numbers up to 1295 can be expressed
  298:             %% as two 36-base digits.)
  299:             1000;
  300:         {{unix,linux},Version} when Version < {2,6,23} ->
  301:             %% On some older 64-bit versions of Linux, the maximum number
  302:             %% of arguments is 16383.
  303:             %% See: http://www.in-ulm.de/~mascheck/various/argmax/
  304:             5440;
  305:         {{unix,darwin},{Major,_,_}} when Major >= 11 ->
  306:             %% "getconf ARG_MAX" still reports 262144 (as in previous
  307:             %% version of MacOS X), but the useful space seem to have
  308:             %% shrunk significantly (or possibly the number of arguments).
  309:             %% 7673
  310:             7500;
  311:         {_,_} ->
  312:             12000
  313:     end.
  314: 
  315: erlc() ->
  316:     case os:find_executable("erlc") of
  317:         false ->
  318:             ct:fail("Can't find erlc");
  319:         Erlc ->
  320:             "\"" ++ Erlc ++ "\""
  321:     end.
  322: 
  323: make_dep_options(Config) ->
  324:     {SrcDir,OutDir,Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  325:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  326:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  327:     BeamFileName = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.beam"),
  328: 
  329:     DepRE = ["/erl_test_ok[.]beam: \\\\$",
  330:              "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  331:              "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  332:              "_OK_"],
  333: 
  334:     DepRETarget =
  335:     ["^target: \\\\$",
  336:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  337:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  338:      "_OK_"],
  339: 
  340:     DepREMP =
  341:     ["/erl_test_ok[.]beam: \\\\$",
  342:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  343:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  344:      [],
  345:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test.hrl:$",
  346:      "_OK_"],
  347: 
  348:     DepREMissing =
  349:     ["/erl_test_missing_header[.]beam: \\\\$",
  350:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_missing_header[.]erl \\\\$",
  351:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl \\\\$",
  352:      "missing.hrl$",
  353:      "_OK_"],
  354: 
  355:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  356: 
  357:     %% Test plain -M
  358:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M", DepRE),
  359:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  360: 
  361:     %% Test -MF File
  362:     DepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "my.deps"),
  363:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MF "++DepFile, ["_OK_"]),
  364:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(DepFile),
  365:     verify_result(binary_to_list(MFBin)++["_OK_"], DepRE),
  366:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  367: 
  368:     %% Test -MD
  369:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MD", ["_OK_"]),
  370:     MDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  371:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(MDFile),
  372:     file:delete(MDFile), %% used further down!
  373:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  374: 
  375:     %% Test -M -MT Target
  376:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MT target", DepRETarget),
  377:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  378: 
  379:     %% Test -MF File -MT Target
  380:     TargetDepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "target.deps"),
  381:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MF "++TargetDepFile++" -MT target",
  382:         ["_OK_"]),
  383:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetDepFile),
  384:     verify_result(binary_to_list(TargetBin)++["_OK_"], DepRETarget),
  385:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  386:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  387: 
  388:     %% Test -MD -MT Target
  389:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MD -MT target", ["_OK_"]),
  390:     TargetMDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  391:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetMDFile),
  392:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  393:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  394: 
  395:     %% Test -M -MQ Target. (Note: Passing a $ on the command line
  396:     %% portably for Unix and Windows is tricky, so we will just test
  397:     %% that MQ works at all.)
  398:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MQ target", DepRETarget),
  399:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  400: 
  401:     %% Test -M -MP
  402:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MP", DepREMP),
  403:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  404: 
  405:     %% Test -M -MG
  406:     MissingHeader = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_missing_header.erl"),
  407:     run(Config, Cmd, MissingHeader, "-M -MG", DepREMissing),
  408:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  409: 
  410:     %%
  411:     %% check the above variants with side-effect -MMD
  412:     %%
  413: 
  414:     %% since compiler is run on the erlang code a warning will be
  415:     %% issued by the compiler, match that.
  416:     WarningRE =
  417:          "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok.erl:[0-9]+:[0-9]+: "
  418:         "Warning: function foo/0 is unused$",
  419:     ErrorRE = "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_missing_header.erl:"
  420:         "[0-9]+:[0-9]+: can't find include file \"missing.hrl\"$",
  421: 
  422:     DepRE_MMD = insert_before("_OK_", WarningRE, DepRE),
  423:     DepRETarget_MMD = insert_before("_OK_", WarningRE, DepRETarget),
  424:     DepREMP_MMD = insert_before("_OK_",WarningRE,DepREMP),
  425:     DepREMissing_MMD = (insert_before("_OK_",ErrorRE,DepREMissing)--
  426:                             ["_OK_"]) ++ ["_ERROR_"],
  427:     CompRE = [WarningRE,"_OK_"],
  428: 
  429: 
  430:     %% Test plain -MMD -M
  431:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M", DepRE_MMD),
  432:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  433:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  434: 
  435:     %% Test -MMD -MF File
  436:     DepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "my.deps"),
  437:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MF "++DepFile, CompRE),
  438:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(DepFile),
  439:     verify_result(binary_to_list(MFBin)++["_OK_"], DepRE),
  440:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  441:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  442: 
  443:     %% Test -MMD -MD
  444:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MD", CompRE),
  445:     MDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  446:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(MDFile),
  447:     file:delete(MDFile), %% used further down!
  448:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  449:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  450: 
  451:     %% Test -MMD -M -MT Target
  452:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MT target", DepRETarget_MMD),
  453:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  454:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  455: 
  456:     %% Test -MMD -MF File -MT Target
  457:     TargetDepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "target.deps"),
  458:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MF "++TargetDepFile++" -MT target",
  459:         CompRE),
  460:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetDepFile),
  461:     verify_result(binary_to_list(TargetBin)++["_OK_"], DepRETarget),
  462:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  463:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  464:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  465: 
  466:     %% Test -MMD -MD -MT Target
  467:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MD -MT target", CompRE),
  468:     TargetMDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  469:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetMDFile),
  470:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  471:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  472:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  473: 
  474:     %% Test -MMD -M -MQ Target. (Note: Passing a $ on the command line
  475:     %% portably for Unix and Windows is tricky, so we will just test
  476:     %% that MQ works at all.)
  477:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MQ target", DepRETarget_MMD),
  478:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  479:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  480: 
  481:     %% Test -MMD -M -MP
  482:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MP", DepREMP_MMD),
  483:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  484:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  485: 
  486:     %% Test -MMD -M -MG
  487:     MissingHeader = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_missing_header.erl"),
  488:     run(Config, Cmd, MissingHeader, "-MMD -M -MG", DepREMissing_MMD),
  489:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  490:     ok.
  491: 
  492: unicode_paths(Config) ->
  493:     case {os:type(), file:native_name_encoding()} of
  494:         {{win32,_}, _} -> {skip, "Unicode paths not supported on windows"};
  495:         {_,latin1} -> {skip, "Cannot interpret unicode filenames when native_name_encoding is latin1"};
  496:         _ ->
  497:             DepRE = ["_OK_"],
  498:             {SrcDir,OutDir0,Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  499:             OutDir = filename:join(OutDir0,"😀"),
  500:             ok = case file:make_dir(OutDir) of
  501:                 {error, eexist} -> ok;
  502:                 ok -> ok;
  503:                 E -> E
  504:             end,
  505:             Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief -o "++OutDir,
  506:             FileName = filename:join([SrcDir, "😀", "erl_test_unicode.erl"]),
  507:             BeamFileName = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_unicode.beam"),
  508:             run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "", DepRE),
  509:             true = exists(BeamFileName),
  510:             file:delete(BeamFileName),
  511:             file:delete(OutDir),
  512:             ok
  513:     end.
  514: 
  515: %%% Tests related to the features mechanism
  516: %% Support macros and functions
  517: -define(OK(Lines), Lines ++ ["_OK_"]).
  518: -define(NOTOK(Lines), Lines ++ ["_ERROR_"]).
  519: 
  520: flatfmt(FStr, Args) ->
  521:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format(FStr, Args)).
  522: 
  523: defopt(Name) -> flatfmt("-D~w", [Name]).
  524: defopt(Name, Value) -> flatfmt("-D~w=~w", [Name, Value]).
  525: 
  526: longopt(enable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("-enable-feature ~w", [Ftr]);
  527: longopt(disable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("-disable-feature ~w", [Ftr]).
  528: 
  529: plusopt(enable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("+\"{feature, ~w, enable}\"", [Ftr]);
  530: plusopt(disable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("+\"{feature, ~w, disable}\"", [Ftr]).
  531: 
  532: options(Opts) -> lists:flatten(lists:join(" ", Opts)).
  533: 
  534: peer(Args) ->
  535:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
  536:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args,
  537:                    connection => 0}),
  538:     {Peer, Node}.
  539: 
  540: %% Error messages to expect
  541: nosingle(Ftr) -> flatfmt("the feature '~w' does not exist", [Ftr]).
  542: 
  543: nomultiple(Ftrs) ->
  544:     Q = fun(A) -> flatfmt("'~w'", [A]) end,
  545:     flatfmt("the features ~s and '~w' do not exist",
  546:             [lists:join(", ",
  547:                         lists:map(Q, lists:droplast(Ftrs))),
  548:              lists:last(Ftrs)]).
  549: 
  550: not_config(Ftr) -> flatfmt("the feature '~w' is not configurable", [Ftr]).
  551: 
  552: syntax(Offender) -> flatfmt("syntax error before: ~w", [Offender]).
  553: 
  554: misplaced_directive() ->
  555:     "feature directive not allowed after exports or record definitions".
  556: 
  557: atom_warning(Atom, Ftr) ->
  558:     flatfmt("atom '~w' is reserved in the experimental feature '~w'",
  559:             [Atom, Ftr]).
  560: 
  561: compile_fun(Config) ->
  562:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  563:     Compile = fun(FName, Opts, Expected) ->
  564:                       Path = case FName of
  565:                                  "" -> "";
  566:                                  FName -> filename:join(SrcDir, FName)
  567:                              end,
  568:                       run(Config, Cmd, Path, Opts, Expected)
  569:               end,
  570:     {Compile, SrcDir, OutDir}.
  571: 
  572: %% Tests
  573: features_erlc_describe(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  574:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  575: 
  576:     Compile("", "-list-features",
  577:             ?NOTOK(["Available features:",
  578:                     "approved_ftr_1",
  579:                     "approved_ftr_2",
  580:                     "experimental_ftr_1",
  581:                     "experimental_ftr_2"])),
  582: 
  583:     Compile("", "-describe-feature experimental_ftr_1",
  584:             ?NOTOK(["experimental_ftr_1",
  585:                     "Type",
  586:                     "Status",
  587:                     "Keywords",
  588:                     skip_lines])),
  589: 
  590:     Compile("", "-describe-feature loop_macro",
  591:             ?NOTOK(["Unknown feature: loop_macro"])).
  592: 
  593: features_erlc_unknown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  594:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  595: 
  596:     %% Test for single invalid feature, using long and +options
  597:     Compile("nofile.erl", longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  598:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  599:     Compile("nofile.erl", plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  600:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  601:     Compile("nofile.erl", longopt(disable, no_ftr),
  602:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  603:     Compile("nofile.erl", plusopt(disable, no_ftr),
  604:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  605: 
  606:     %% Test for multiple invalid features
  607:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  608:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  609:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  610:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  611:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr),
  612:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  613:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  614:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  615:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  616:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  617:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  618:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  619:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  620:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  621: 
  622:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  623:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  624:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  625:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  626:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  627:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  628: 
  629:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  630:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr),
  631:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  632:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  633:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  634:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  635:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  636:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  637: 
  638:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  639:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  640:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  641:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  642:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  643:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  644:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  645:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  646: 
  647:     %% Rejected and permanent features can not be configured.
  648:     %% Rejected feature
  649:     Compile("nofile.erl",
  650:             options([longopt(enable, rejected_ftr)]),
  651:             ?NOTOK([not_config(rejected_ftr),
  652:                     skip_lines])),
  653: 
  654:     %% Permanent feature
  655:     Compile("nofile.erl",
  656:             options([longopt(enable, permanent_ftr)]),
  657:             ?NOTOK([not_config(permanent_ftr),
  658:                     skip_lines])).
  659: 
  660: features_directives(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  661:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  662: 
  663:     %% Test for misplaced feature directive (enable)
  664:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  665:             options([defopt(misplaced_enable)]),
  666:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
  667:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature.*misplaced",
  668:                     skip_lines])),
  669:     %% Test for misplaced feature directive (disable)
  670:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  671:             options([defopt(misplaced_disable)]),
  672:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
  673:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature.*misplaced",
  674:                     skip_lines])),
  675: 
  676:     %% Test for unknown feature in directive (enable)
  677:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  678:             options([defopt(enable_unknown)]),
  679:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(unlesser),
  680:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature",
  681:                     skip_lines])),
  682:     %% Test for unknown feature in directive (disable)
  683:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  684:             options([defopt(disable_unknown)]),
  685:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(unlesser),
  686:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature",
  687:                     skip_lines])),
  688: 
  689:     %% Enable a feature on the command line and disable the same in a
  690:     %% directive
  691:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  692:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  693:                      defopt(disable_exp2),
  694:                      defopt(no_dir_enable_exp2)]),
  695:             ?OK([])).
  696: 
  697: features_atom_warnings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  698:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  699: 
  700:     %% Check for keyword warnings.  Not all are checked.
  701:     Compile("ignorant.erl", "+warn_keywords",
  702:             ?OK([atom_warning(until, experimental_ftr_2),
  703:                  skip_lines,
  704:                  atom_warning(ifn, experimental_ftr_1),
  705:                  skip_lines,
  706:                  atom_warning(while, experimental_ftr_2),
  707:                  skip_lines])),
  708: 
  709:     %% Check for keyword warnings, resulting in error.
  710:     %% Not all warnings are checked.
  711:     Compile("ignorant.erl", "+warn_keywords -Werror",
  712:             ?NOTOK([skip_lines,
  713:                     atom_warning(until, experimental_ftr_2),
  714:                     skip_lines,
  715:                     atom_warning(ifn, experimental_ftr_1),
  716:                     skip_lines,
  717:                     atom_warning(while, experimental_ftr_2),
  718:                     skip_lines])),
  719: 
  720:     %% Check for keyword warnings.  Not all warnings are checked.
  721:     %% This file has a -compile attribute for keyword warnings.
  722:     Compile("ignorant_directive.erl", "",
  723:             ?OK([atom_warning(ifn, experimental_ftr_1),
  724:                  skip_lines,
  725:                  atom_warning(while, experimental_ftr_2),
  726:                  skip_lines,
  727:                  atom_warning(until, experimental_ftr_2),
  728:                  skip_lines])),
  729: 
  730:     %% Override warning attribute inside file
  731:     Compile("ignorant_directive.erl", "+nowarn_keywords",
  732:             ?OK([])),
  733: 
  734:     %% File has quoted atoms which are keywords in experimental_ftr_2.
  735:     %% We should see no warnings.
  736:     Compile("foo.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  737:                                 "+warn_keywords"]),
  738:             ?OK([])).
  739: 
  740: features(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  741:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  742: 
  743:     %% Simple compile - baseline for this file.  Really needed?
  744:     %% It uses atoms that are keywords in  experimental features.
  745:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  746:             [],
  747:             ?OK([])),
  748: 
  749:     %% Enable and disable the same feature on the command line to
  750:     %% check that the ordering semantics is honoured.
  751:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  752:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  753:                      longopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  754:             ?OK([])),
  755: 
  756:     %% As above, with +options
  757:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  758:             options([plusopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  759:                      plusopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  760:             ?OK([])),
  761: 
  762:     %% Mixed options
  763:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  764:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  765:                      plusopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  766:             ?OK([])),
  767: 
  768:     %% Mixed options
  769:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  770:             options([plusopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  771:                      longopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  772:             ?OK([])),
  773: 
  774:     %% Enable a feature and see errors
  775:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  776:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  777:             ?NOTOK([syntax(ifn),
  778:                     skip_lines,
  779:                     syntax(ifn),
  780:                     skip_lines])),
  781: 
  782:     %% Enable another feature and see other errors
  783:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  784:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  785:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
  786:                     skip_lines,
  787:                     syntax(until),
  788:                     skip_lines,
  789:                     syntax(while),
  790:                     skip_lines,
  791:                     syntax(while),
  792:                     skip_lines,
  793:                     syntax(until),
  794:                     skip_lines])),
  795: 
  796:     %% Enable both features and see even more errors
  797:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  798:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  799:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  800:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
  801:                     skip_lines,
  802:                     syntax(until),
  803:                     skip_lines,
  804:                     syntax(ifn),
  805:                     skip_lines,
  806:                     syntax(while),
  807:                     skip_lines,
  808:                     syntax(until),
  809:                     skip_lines,
  810:                     syntax(ifn),
  811:                     skip_lines])),
  812: 
  813:     ok.
  814: 
  815: features_macros(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  816:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  817: 
  818:     Compile("f_macros.erl", "", ?OK([])),
  819: 
  820:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  821:     Call = fun(Node, Fun) ->
  822:                    erpc:call(Node, f_macros, Fun, [])
  823:            end,
  824: 
  825:     {module, f_macros} =
  826:         erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  827: 
  828:     true = Call(Node0, has_experimental),
  829:     false = Call(Node0, has_hindley_milner),
  830:     false = Call(Node0, with_hm),
  831:     false = Call(Node0, uses_experimental),
  832:     false = Call(Node0, uses_exp2),
  833: 
  834:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  835: 
  836:     Compile("f_macros.erl", longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  837:             ?OK([])),
  838: 
  839:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  840: 
  841:     true = erpc:call(Node1, erlang, module_loaded, [erl_features]),
  842: 
  843:     %% Starting from OTP 26, compile-time features don't need to be
  844:     %% enabled in the runtime system.
  845:     {module, f_macros} =
  846:         erpc:call(Node1, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  847:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  848:     [approved_ftr_1, approved_ftr_2, experimental_ftr_1] =
  849:         erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, used, [f_macros]),
  850: 
  851:     peer:stop(Peer1),
  852: 
  853:     %% Restart with feature enabled in runtime
  854:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  855:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1"]),
  856:     %% Now we can load it
  857:     {module, f_macros} =
  858:         erpc:call(Node2, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  859: 
  860:     true = Call(Node2, uses_experimental),
  861:     false = Call(Node2, uses_exp2),
  862:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  863: 
  864:     Compile("f_macros.erl", longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  865:             ?OK([])),
  866:     {Peer3, Node3} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  867:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  868:     false = Call(Node3, uses_experimental),
  869:     true = Call(Node3, uses_exp2),
  870:     peer:stop(Peer3),
  871: 
  872:     Compile("f_macros.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  873:                                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  874:             ?OK([])),
  875:     {Peer4, Node4} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  876:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1",
  877:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  878:     true = Call(Node4, uses_experimental),
  879:     true = Call(Node4, uses_exp2),
  880:     peer:stop(Peer4),
  881: 
  882:     ok.
  883: 
  884: features_disable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  885:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  886: 
  887:     Call = fun(Node, Fun) ->
  888:                    erpc:call(Node, f_disable, Fun, [])
  889:            end,
  890: 
  891:     Compile("f_disable.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  892:                                       longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  893:             ?OK([])),
  894: 
  895:     {Peer, Node} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  896:                          "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1",
  897:                          "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  898:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  899:     [approved_ftr_2] =
  900:         erpc:call(Node, erl_features, used, [f_disable]),
  901: 
  902:     no_experimental = Call(Node, no_experimental),
  903:     no_exp2 = Call(Node, no_ftrs),
  904:     peer:stop(Peer),
  905: 
  906:     ok.
  907: 
  908: features_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  909:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  910: 
  911:     Compile("foo.erl", longopt(enable, all),
  912:             ?OK([])),
  913: 
  914:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  915:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  916:     [approved_ftr_1,approved_ftr_2,experimental_ftr_1,experimental_ftr_2] =
  917:         erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [foo]),
  918:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  919: 
  920:     Compile("foo.erl", longopt(disable, all),
  921:             ?OK([])),
  922: 
  923:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  924:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  925:     [] = erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, used, [foo]),
  926:     {module, foo} = erpc:call(Node1, code, load_file, [foo]),
  927:     peer:stop(Peer1),
  928: 
  929:     Compile("foo.erl", options([longopt(disable, all),
  930:                                 longopt(enable, approved_ftr_2)]),
  931:             ?OK([])),
  932: 
  933:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  934:                            "-disable-feature", "all"]),
  935:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  936:     [approved_ftr_2] = erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, used, [foo]),
  937:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  938: 
  939:     ok.
  940: 
  941: features_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  942:     {_Compile, SrcDir, _OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  943: 
  944:     %% Note that we put SrcDir in the load path as there is where we
  945:     %% have the precompiled beam file.
  946:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", SrcDir]),
  947: 
  948:     %% For a file compiled with an older version, i.e., with no Meta
  949:     %% chunk, we should see no used features.
  950:     [] = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [older]),
  951:     %% .. and we should be able to load it.
  952:     {module,older} = erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [older]),
  953: 
  954:     [] = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used,
  955:                    [filename:join(SrcDir, "older.beam")]),
  956: 
  957:     %% Behaviour for non existent modules
  958:     not_found = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [none]),
  959:     not_found = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, ["none.beam"]),
  960:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  961: 
  962:     ok.
  963: 
  964: features_runtime(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  965:     AllFtrs = [approved_ftr_1,
  966:                approved_ftr_2,
  967:                experimental_ftr_1,
  968:                experimental_ftr_2,
  969:                permanent_ftr,
  970:                rejected_ftr],
  971:     ConfigFtrs = [approved_ftr_1,
  972:                   approved_ftr_2,
  973:                   experimental_ftr_1,
  974:                   experimental_ftr_2],
  975:     Approved = [approved_ftr_2,
  976:                 approved_ftr_1],
  977: 
  978:     {_Compile, _SrcDir, _OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  979: 
  980:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer([]),
  981: 
  982:     %% Get all known features
  983:     AllFtrs = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, all, []),
  984:     ConfigFtrs = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, configurable, []),
  985:     Approved =  erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, enabled, []),
  986: 
  987:     %% Keywords from enabled (here the approved) features
  988:     %% (does not need to be quoted since it comes from the peer node)
  989:     [unless] =  erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, keywords, []),
  990: 
  991:     Info = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, info, [permanent_ftr]),
  992:     true = is_map(Info),
  993:     true = lists:all(fun(K) -> is_map_key(K, Info) end,
  994:                      [status,type,description,short,experimental]),
  995: 
  996:     %% Try to get info for unknown feature - raises error
  997:     try
  998:         erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, info, [unknown_feature]) of
  999:         Value ->
 1000:             ct:fail({value_returned_for_unknown_feature, Value})
 1001:     catch
 1002:         error:{exception, invalid_feature, _} ->
 1003:             ok;
 1004:         Class:Reason ->
 1005:             ct:fail({unexpected_exception, {Class, Reason}})
 1006:     end,
 1007: 
 1008:     peer:stop(Peer0),
 1009: 
 1010:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_2"]),
 1011:     [experimental_ftr_2, approved_ftr_2, approved_ftr_1] =
 1012:         erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, enabled, []),
 1013:     [while, until, unless] =  erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, keywords, []),
 1014: 
 1015:     peer:stop(Peer1),
 1016: 
 1017:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-disable-feature", "all"]),
 1018:     [] = erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, enabled, []),
 1019:     [] =  erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, keywords, []),
 1020: 
 1021:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1022:     ok.
 1023: 
 1024: features_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1025:     {Compile, _SrcDir, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
 1026: 
 1027:     %% Ensure that the feature experimental_ftr_1 is enabled in the
 1028:     %% include file and generates an error
 1029:     Compile("f_include_1.erl", [],
 1030:             ?NOTOK([syntax(ifn),
 1031:                     skip_lines])),
 1032: 
 1033:     %% This will disable a feature after a record has been defined.
 1034:     %% Error expected
 1035:     Compile("f_include_1.erl", defopt(end_include),
 1036:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
 1037:                     skip_lines])),
 1038: 
 1039:     %% Ensure that the macro knows that experimental_ftr_1 is enabled
 1040:     %% in the include file.
 1041:     Compile("f_include_2.erl", defopt(end_include),
 1042:             ?OK([])),
 1043: 
 1044:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1045:                            "-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_1"]),
 1046: 
 1047:     {module, f_include_2} = erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [f_include_2]),
 1048:     active = erpc:call(Node0, f_include_2, foo, [2]),
 1049:     peer:stop(Peer0),
 1050: 
 1051:     Compile("f_include_3.erl", [],
 1052:             ?OK([])),
 1053: 
 1054:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1055:                            "-enable-feature", "all"]),
 1056:     exp2_enabled = erpc:call(Node1, f_include_3, foo, [1]),
 1057:     peer:stop(Peer1),
 1058: 
 1059:     Compile("f_include_3.erl", defopt(end_prefix),
 1060:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
 1061:                     "experimental_ftr_2",
 1062:                     skip_lines])),
 1063: 
 1064:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl", defopt(enable_exp_2, 0),
 1065:             ?OK([])),
 1066:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
 1067:     {conditional, on, until} = erpc:call(Node2, f_include_exp2, foo, []),
 1068:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1069: 
 1070:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1071:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 0),
 1072:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
 1073:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
 1074:                     skip_lines])),
 1075: 
 1076:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1077:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 1)]),
 1078:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
 1079:                     skip_lines])),
 1080: 
 1081:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1082:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 2),
 1083:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
 1084:             ?OK([])),
 1085: 
 1086:     {Peer3, Node3} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1087:                            "-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_2"]),
 1088:     {conditional, off, none} = erpc:call(Node3, f_include_exp2, foo, []),
 1089: 
 1090:     [approved_ftr_1, approved_ftr_2, experimental_ftr_2] =
 1091:         erpc:call(Node3, erl_features, used, [f_include_exp2]),
 1092:     peer:stop(Peer3),
 1093: 
 1094:     ok.
 1095: 
 1096: %% Runs a command.
 1097: 
 1098: run(Config, Cmd0, Name, Options, Expect) ->
 1099:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " " ++ Options ++ " " ++ Name,
 1100:     io:format("~ts", [Cmd]),
 1101:     Result = run_command(Config, Cmd),
 1102:     verify_result(Result, Expect).
 1103: 
 1104: verify_result(Result, Expect) ->
 1105:     Messages = split(Result, [], []),
 1106:     io:format("Result: ~p", [Messages]),
 1107:     io:format("Expected: ~p", [Expect]),
 1108:     match_messages_x(Messages, Expect).
 1109: 
 1110: %% insert What before Item, crash if Item is not found
 1111: insert_before(Item, What, [Item|List]) ->
 1112:     [What,Item|List];
 1113: insert_before(Item, What, [Other|List]) ->
 1114:     [Other|insert_before(Item, What, List)].
 1115: 
 1116: split([$\n|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1117:     split(Rest, [], [lists:reverse(Current)|Lines]);
 1118: split([$\r|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1119:     split(Rest, Current, Lines);
 1120: split([Char|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1121:     split(Rest, [Char|Current], Lines);
 1122: split([], [], Lines) ->
 1123:     lists:reverse(Lines);
 1124: split([], Current, Lines) ->
 1125:     split([], [], [lists:reverse(Current)|Lines]).
 1126: 
 1127: match_messages_x(Msgs0, Regexps0) ->
 1128:     Msgs = lists:droplast(Msgs0),
 1129:     Regexps = lists:droplast(Regexps0),
 1130:     Return = lists:last(Msgs0),
 1131:     ExpRet = lists:last(Regexps0),
 1132:     match_messages(Msgs, Regexps),
 1133:     match_one(Return, ExpRet).
 1134: 
 1135: match_messages(_, [skip_lines]) ->
 1136:     ok;
 1137: match_messages([_Msg|Rest1], [skip_one|Rest2]) ->
 1138:     match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1139: match_messages([Msg|Rest1], [skip_lines, Regexp|Rest2]) ->
 1140:     case match(Msg, Regexp) of
 1141:         match ->
 1142:             match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1143:         nomatch ->
 1144:             match_messages(Rest1, [skip_lines, Regexp|Rest2])
 1145:     end;
 1146: match_messages([Msg|Rest1], [Regexp|Rest2]) ->
 1147:     match_one(Msg, Regexp),
 1148:     match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1149: match_messages([], [Expect|Rest]) ->
 1150:     ct:fail({too_few_messages, [Expect|Rest]});
 1151: match_messages([Msg|Rest], []) ->
 1152:     ct:fail({too_many_messages, [Msg|Rest]});
 1153: match_messages([], []) ->
 1154:     ok.
 1155: 
 1156: match_one(Msg, Regexp) ->
 1157:     case match(Msg, Regexp) of
 1158:         match ->
 1159:             ok;
 1160:         nomatch ->
 1161:             io:format("Not matching: ~s\n", [Msg]),
 1162:             io:format("Regexp      : ~s\n", [Regexp]),
 1163:             ct:fail(message_mismatch)
 1164:     end.
 1165: 
 1166: match(Msg, Regexp) ->
 1167:     re:run(Msg, Regexp, [{capture,none}, unicode]).
 1168: 
 1169: get_cmd(Cfg) ->
 1170:     {SrcDir, IncDir, OutDir} = get_dirs(Cfg),
 1171:     Cmd = erlc() ++ " -I" ++ IncDir ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
 1172:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd}.
 1173: 
 1174: get_dirs(Cfg) ->
 1175:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Cfg),
 1176:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Cfg),
 1177:     SrcDir = filename:join(DataDir, "src"),
 1178:     IncDir = filename:join(DataDir, "include"),
 1179:     {SrcDir, IncDir, PrivDir}.
 1180: 
 1181: exists(Name) ->
 1182:     filelib:is_file(Name).
 1183: 
 1184: %% Runs the command using os:cmd/1.
 1185: %%
 1186: %% Returns the output from the command (as a list of characters with
 1187: %% embedded newlines).  The very last line will indicate the
 1188: %% exit status of the command, where _OK_ means zero, and _ERROR_
 1189: %% a non-zero exit status.
 1190: 
 1191: run_command(Config, Cmd) ->
 1192:     TmpDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "tmp"),
 1193:     file:make_dir(TmpDir),
 1194:     {RunFile, Run, Script} = run_command(TmpDir, os:type(), Cmd),
 1195:     ok = file:write_file(RunFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(Script)),
 1196:     os:cmd(Run).
 1197: 
 1198: run_command(Dir, {win32, _}, Cmd) ->
 1199:     BatchFile = filename:join(Dir, "run.bat"),
 1200:     Run = re:replace(filename:rootname(BatchFile), "/", "\\",
 1201:                      [global,{return,list}]),
 1202:     {BatchFile,
 1203:      Run,
 1204:      ["@echo off\r\n",
 1205:       "set ERLC_EMULATOR=", ct:get_progname(), "\r\n",
 1206:       Cmd, "\r\n",
 1207:       "if errorlevel 1 echo _ERROR_\r\n",
 1208:       "if not errorlevel 1 echo _OK_\r\n"]};
 1209: run_command(Dir, {unix, _}, Cmd) ->
 1210:     Name = filename:join(Dir, "run"),
 1211:     {Name,
 1212:      "/bin/sh " ++ Name,
 1213:      ["#!/bin/sh\n",
 1214:       "ERLC_EMULATOR='", ct:get_progname(), "'\n",
 1215:       "export ERLC_EMULATOR\n",
 1216:       Cmd, "\n",
 1217:       "case $? in\n",
 1218:       "  0) echo '_OK_';;\n",
 1219:       "  *) echo '_ERROR_';;\n",
 1220:       "esac\n"]};
 1221: run_command(_Dir, Other, _Cmd) ->
 1222:     ct:fail("Don't know how to test exit code for ~p", [Other]).
